text: <@UQ4ED6QFM> confirming the fix for you for starting the watch successfully. I'll test an `auth` sometime today

Global content is not fetched when fetching a module. It is best to think about the relationship between global content and code in a similar fashion to the relationship between a page and its template/modules. The code provides the default content but once there is an edit the defaults are decoupled from the code. Does that help?
What version are you using (e.g. `hs --version`)? I ask because we had a bug where refreshing a token was not working as expected, so you may need to upgrade.
I used `hs init` to start my project, that's how I got my first token.

My *HS Version* is 1.0.13

Okay I ran `hs auth personalaccesskey`  and it seems to be working now.
:thinking_face: you shouldn’t have to run that command again and everything should just work. if it happens again, please let us know because i’d like to get to the bottom of it.
Hi Gregory, that does help. Are the ID's that are set in the meta.json and in the fields of any influence on global content?
I converted a local module to global that was used on 40+ blogs but editing the content did not affect any of the blogs. It seemed as if a local copy was kept for these posts.
And was the local content affecting global content in the past? Cause I had the issue in older projects where syncing the modules would overwrite global content.
